content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull-edge deep under the nose and a right hand three-finger dimple at the arete. From there, slap the right hand up the arete several times to the nose, hold the balance while bringing the left hand along, situate on edges, gain the left hand hueco, and finish up the slab using the arete and bumps/edges.
content.protection: A pair of pads work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north side of the boulder's east-pointing nose.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the jug. From there, throw a heel on next to the hands, move out the nose on thin edges and bumps, reach the nose, gain a big left hand sidepull on the face, work the right hand up slopers on the arete, eventually reach a left hand edge, and finish up the remaining edges on the slab to reach an easy topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. With the exception of a few trees guarding the fall zone's boundary, it's a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the east face and northeast arete of Lubbock Lights.
